p: It needs to be evaluated in the light of Mordecai et al. [ 47], who postulated the optimal temperature for malaria transmission is lower than 32 Â°C, as suggested earlier [ 3]. In the state of Punjab, owing to the better economy and health seeking behavior of the inhabitants, the malaria burden is minimal. Studies have suggested that large areas of the United States and Europe are characterized by suitable climates for malaria transmission, yet only few cases occur because of the strength of their public health infrastructure and other economic factors [ 47].
